Posts.Content: I had sentinel node removal, left breast masectomy and immediate reconstruction and right breast reduction on the 30th january. I was able to come out the following day and coped well. The district nurse called daily and took my drain out on the 4th day. I was pleasantly surprised with my recovery. However,  I am 61, retired and my husband is also retired. Everyone is an individual, with a range of different support and a different recovery, be gentle with yourself. Wishing you all the very best  on your journey. The support I have  had from the hospital and my cancer nurse has been great also this site and breast care charity, do not use Mr Google!!  The waiting is a really hard part. Sending you lots of love  and hugs. Xxx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy op help

Posts.Content: Oh dear, I feel so sorry for you. Please ring the McMillan helpline or Breast care they have people there who can help you. Citizens advice may be able to help. There are lots of kind people about who can assist you. So get out there and nag them!! ! Are there any local groups you can join, you could compare similar situations ? Sending you lots and lots of virtual hugs and live. Xx
Posts.Title: I just cant take anymore

Posts.Content: Helen, I had a masectomy, implant reconstruction and other breast reduction on January 30th. I was out of hospital the next day. My drain came out after 4 days without any pain. I have been very fortunate and made very good progress. I’ve done my exercises, building up gradually, 3 times a day. I have been pleasantly surprised by my recovery. Scars healing so nicely that the consultant asked if he could take pictures!!! I never thought I would be a page 3 girl!! The worst part of the whole process I have found is waiting for results. All the very best to you for the operation. Sendings you lots of love and hugs xx
